8.0: "At the next meal I'll eat": Not just at the meal that is customary - one in the morning and one in the evening - rather even immediately, if you clear the table and make the concluding blessing, it's permissible, since the Rabbi's didn't differentiate.

1.0: A drop of dairy that falls upon a piece of meat, if it gives to the piece a taste - It will be forbidden...if the entire piece is outside of the sauce.  This is discussed like it is said in Perek "Gid HaNaase" (Daf צו of Maasechet Chullin).  Therefore, from this discussion, the piece [of meat] will nullify the drop [of dairy] and not the remaining pieces because the dairy spreads upon the whole piece, and doesn't spread from the piece to the other pieces.
